definitions: arranged in or extending along a straight line or sequential order
relating to or characterized by mathematical relationships of the first degree
examples: The graph shows a linear relationship between temperature and pressure
We need to follow a linear approach to solve this problem
Linear equations are simpler to solve than quadratic ones
The artist used linear perspective in her drawings

definitions: covered with lines or showing lines on the surface
having material attached to the inside for protection or warmth
examples: Her lined face showed years of outdoor work
Use lined paper for writing your essay
The coat was lined with soft fleece for winter
She wore a fur-lined jacket in the snow

definitions: relating to language or the study of human speech and communication
examples: She has strong linguistic abilities in multiple languages
The linguistic analysis revealed patterns in regional dialects

definitions: joined or connected physically or conceptually with something else
examples: The two issues are closely linked in the report
Their arms were linked as they walked together

definitions: having lips of a specified kind or shape
having a rim or edge that projects like a lip
examples: The thin-lipped man rarely smiled at anyone
She noticed the full-lipped statue in the museum
The lipped container prevents spills during pouring
Use a lipped bowl for mixing the batter

definitions: converted from a solid or gas state into liquid form
examples: The liquefied butter was ready for the recipe
Liquefied natural gas is easier to transport by ship

definitions: having the properties of a liquid with no fixed shape
smooth and flowing in movement or sound quality
easily converted to cash or other forms of payment
examples: Water changes from liquid to solid when frozen
The liquid metal poured into the mold smoothly
Her liquid voice captivated the entire audience
The dancer moved with liquid grace across stage
They keep liquid assets for emergency expenses
The company maintains liquid investments for flexibility

definitions: converted from a solid or gas state into liquid form
examples: The liquified chocolate was perfect for dipping
They stored liquified oxygen in special containers

definitions: included as an item in a list or inventory
officially registered or recognized by an authority or organization
examples: All listed items must be checked before shipping
The listed ingredients appear on the product label
This is a listed building protected by preservation laws
The company is listed on the stock exchange

definitions: provided with light or lighting to make visible
set on fire or burning with a flame
examples: The street was brightly lit by new LED lamps
A well-lit workspace improves productivity and mood
The lit candles created a romantic dinner atmosphere
Keep lit cigarettes away from flammable materials

definitions: containing less of specified substances like calories, fat, or alcohol
examples: She prefers lite beer with her evening meal
The lite version has half the calories of regular

definitions: taking words in their usual or most basic sense without metaphor
representing the exact words of the original text or speech
examples: The literal meaning differs from the figurative interpretation
He takes everything in a literal sense unfortunately
This is a literal translation from the ancient text
She provided a literal transcript of the conversation

definitions: able to read and write competently in a language
examples: The literate population has increased dramatically this century
Computer literate employees are essential in modern offices

definitions: covered with carelessly scattered objects or waste materials
examples: The beach was littered with plastic bottles sadly
Her desk was littered with unfinished project papers

definitions: comparative form of little meaning smaller in size or amount
examples: The littler puppy needs extra care and attention
She chose the littler portion to save room for dessert

definitions: relating to liturgy or public religious worship and ritual ceremonies
examples: The liturgical calendar guides the church's worship schedule
They wore special liturgical vestments for the ceremony

definitions: suitable or good enough to live in with reasonable comfort
examples: The renovations made the old house livable again
They seek a livable wage to support their family

definitions: full of life, energy, movement, and excitement
intellectually stimulating, entertaining, or visually bright and striking
examples: The lively music got everyone dancing at the party
Children became lively after their afternoon snack
We had a lively debate about environmental policies
The artist used lively colors in her paintings

definitions: furiously angry to an extreme or unreasonable degree
having a dark bluish or grayish color especially from bruising
examples: She was livid when she discovered the betrayal
The manager was livid about the missed deadline
The livid bruise covered most of his shoulder
His face turned livid from lack of oxygen

definitions: carrying or bearing a load of goods or cargo
having a lot of money or expensive possessions
charged with hidden implications or weighted to produce a particular outcome
examples: The loaded truck moved slowly up the hill
Make sure the camera is loaded with fresh film
Her loaded parents bought her a luxury car
The loaded investor made another large donation
That's a loaded question designed to trap me
The dice were loaded to favor certain numbers

definitions: having the characteristics of loam with mixed clay, sand, and organic matter
examples: The loamy soil was perfect for growing vegetables
Roses thrive in rich, loamy garden beds

definitions: having rounded projections or divisions shaped like lobes
examples: The lobed leaves help identify this oak species
Examine the lobed structure under the microscope carefully

definitions: restricted or confined to a particular area or part
examples: The infection remained localised to the wound site
They experienced localised flooding after heavy rains

definitions: restricted or confined to a particular area or part
examples: The doctor said the pain was localized
We're seeing localized weather patterns this week

definitions: situated in a particular place or position geographically
examples: The hotel is located near the city center
The newly located restaurant attracts many customers daily

definitions: crazy, insane, or exhibiting extremely foolish behavior
examples: That loco idea could get someone seriously hurt
He went completely loco after losing his job

definitions: relating to or effecting movement from one place to another
examples: The patient's locomotive abilities improved with physical therapy
Locomotive skills develop rapidly in young children

definitions: of imposing height extending high up from ground level
elevated in character, purpose, or ideals showing noble qualities
examples: The lofty mountains touched the clouds above
Lofty ceilings make the room feel more spacious
She has lofty ambitions to change the world
His lofty ideals inspired the entire movement

definitions: relating to or expressed in terms of logarithms in mathematics
examples: The data follows a logarithmic growth pattern clearly
Use logarithmic scale for this type of graph

definitions: relating to the detailed organization and implementation of complex operations
examples: We faced several logistic challenges during the move
The logistic support ensured smooth military operations

definitions: relating to the detailed coordination of complex operations involving many parts
examples: The event posed many logistical problems to solve
Logistical planning took months before the conference

definitions: being the only one without others nearby or accompanying
examples: A lone wolf howled in the distant mountains
The lone survivor told the harrowing rescue story

definitions: sad because of being alone or isolated from others
examples: She felt lonesome after moving to the city
The lonesome cowboy rode across the empty plains

definitions: fairly long but not extremely so in length or duration
examples: She wore her hair in a longish style
The meeting ran for a longish three hours

definitions: running lengthwise or relating to longitude in geography or research
examples: The longitudinal study tracked subjects for twenty years
Make longitudinal cuts along the wooden beam

definitions: having existed or continued for a long time historically
examples: They resolved their longstanding dispute through mediation
The company has a longstanding tradition of excellence

definitions: having a specified appearance when combined with other descriptive words
examples: She's a professional-looking woman in her thirties
That's a suspicious-looking package by the door

definitions: silly, crazy, or exhibiting eccentric and foolish behavior
examples: His loony ideas always make us laugh
Stop acting so loony in public places

definitions: made less tight, firm, or compact than before
examples: He loosened his tie after the formal dinner
The loosened soil was ready for planting seeds

definitions: stolen or pillaged especially during war or civil disorder
examples: The looted artifacts were returned to the museum
Looted stores showed the extent of civil unrest

definitions: with one side lower, smaller, or less developed than the other
examples: His lopsided grin made everyone smile back
The lopsided cake still tasted delicious despite appearances

definitions: having or showing the proud, superior manner of a lord
examples: He dismissed their concerns with lordly indifference
The cat maintained a lordly pose on the windowsill

definitions: allowing data compression or conversion without any loss of information
examples: Use lossless compression for archiving important photos
This lossless audio format preserves original quality

definitions: involving data compression that loses some information to reduce file size
examples: JPEG is a lossy format for image compression
Lossy compression reduces file size but sacrifices quality

definitions: very poor or bad in quality or condition
feeling ill or physically uncomfortable and unwell
examples: The restaurant served lousy food last night
He did a lousy job painting the fence
I feel lousy with this terrible head cold
She's been lousy all week with the flu

definitions: fitted with angled slats that allow air flow while blocking rain
examples: The louvered windows provide ventilation and privacy
Install louvered vents to improve attic air circulation

definitions: having qualities that inspire love, affection, or warm feelings
examples: The lovable puppy won everyone's heart instantly
Despite his flaws, he's a lovable character

definitions: held dear or regarded with deep affection by someone
examples: She felt loved and supported by her family
The loved teacher retired after forty years

definitions: without love, affection, or warmth in relationships or circumstances
examples: They stayed together in a loveless marriage
The loveless childhood affected him deeply as adult

definitions: feeling weak, depressed, or ill because of unrequited love
examples: The lovesick teenager wrote poetry all night
He's been lovesick since she moved away
